application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: Amended Specification: 1. Four lime trees (T1-4) situated to right hand side bottom boundary of rear garden. Annual reduction in height to previous pollarding points, removal of dead wood and necessary re-shaping 2. Purple plum (T5), approx 8-9m in height on right hand side boundary close to house in rear garden. Tree is a little dense and wide spreading. Crown thin by 30% including removal of dead wood, water shoots and necessary re-shaping. 3. Red Hawthorn (T6), approx 6m in height on right hand side boundary of front garden. Tree is a little dense and very wide spreading into road. Lift to 2.4m to allow unimpeded pedestrian access. No thin required.18 Stradella Road on boundary with 16 Stradella Road: 1. 18 A: A Yew tree (T8) approximately 5m in height, situated on right hand boundary with 18A Stradella road (left hand side of rear garden of 18A Stradella road). Tree is dense and wide spreading and obscuring light to Acer tree in number 16 garden and causing plum in 18A to lean precariously to obtain space and light. Reduce in height by 3m and round off as a more compact shape. 2. 18 A Common Sycamore (T9) approximately 10m in height, situated on boundary with 18D garden. Tree is a little tall and thin. Reduce in height by 2m and reshape. 3. 18 D Lime (T7) approximately 7m in height, situated on right hand boundary with 18D Stradella Road (left hand side of rear garden of 18D Stradella Road). Single large branch overhanging into garden of 16 Stradella and compromising Acer situated beneath. Remove single over hanging branch (crown lift).
